hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day Bollinger Band width compresses to <15% of price, a breakout above the 20-day high with >5% daily volume spike will signal momentum resumption with 3:1 reward/risk profile.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede directional moves. Volatility compression during institutional accumulation periods (evidenced by price >$85K) suggests pending expansion. Volume-confirmed breakouts from tight ranges have historically led to sustained moves in crypto.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day Bollinger Band width <15% of price
BTC closes >20-day high on >5% volume spike vs 20-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% gain from entry or BTC 20-day RSI >75
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% below entry or close below 20-day moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain >3 days or immediately reverses through support on equal volume, indicating false breakout.
